page.title: 13Safety and Dangers.
page.content: In our village there are 5 openings onto the main road with poor views of traffic. Vehicles coming down the hill often exceed the 30 mph limit (which excludes 7 homes) causing danger to cyclists and horse riders. The litter bin is badly sited over the road from the sweet shop. Large lorries have to reverse out of Village Farm onto the main road but cannot see behind them. Children cannot be seen from tractors if they stand too close and must not try to drive them or ride on open trailers. Machinery, especially in motion, plastic bags and climbing on bales can all be dangerous. There is an unfenced steep drop to the burn behind the Village Hall and unsupervised children walking along Tarry could fall into the deep pool behind dam. Many plants and berries are poisonous and must not be eaten.
